item.title: Step 1: Honesty - David’s Story about Sex Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 1 - Honesty: Admit that you, of yourself, are powerless to overcome your addictions and that your life has become unmanageable. Watch David's story about sex addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 2: Hope - Preston’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 2 - Hope: Come to believe that the power of God can restore you to complete spiritual health. Watch Preston's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 3: Trust in God - Sharon’s Story about Crystal Meth Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 3 - Trust in God: Decide to turn your will and your life over to the care of God the Eternal Father and His Son, Jesus Christ. Watch Sharon's story about crystal meth addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 4: Truth - Austin’s Story about Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 4 - Truth: Make a searching and fearless written moral inventory of yourself. Watch Austin's story about addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 5: Confession - Jessica’s Story about Food Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 5 - Confession: Admit to yourself, to your Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ, to proper priesthood authority, and to another person the exact nature of your wrongs.

item.title: Step 6: Change of Heart - Aram’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 6 - Change of Heart: Become entirely ready to have God remove all your character weaknesses. Watch Aram's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 7: Humility - Holly’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 7 - Humility: Humbly ask Heavenly Father to remove your shortcomings. Watch Holly's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 8: Forgiveness - Larry’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 8 - Seeking Forgiveness: Make a written list of all persons you have harmed and become willing to make restitution to them. Watch Larry's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 9: Restitution and Reconciliation - John’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 9 - Wherever possible, make direct restitution to all persons you have harmed. Watch John's story about drug addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 10: Daily Accountability - Adrienne’s Story about Cocaine Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 10 - Daily Accountability: Continue to take personal inventory, and when you are wrong promptly admit it. Watch Adrienne's story about cocaine addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 11: Personal Revelation - Lindsay’s Story about Heroin Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 11 - Personal Revelation: Seek through prayer and meditation to know the Lord’s will and to have the power to carry it out. Lindsay's story about heroin addiction recovery.

item.title: Step 12: Service - Erik’s Story about Drug Addiction Recovery
item.description: Step 12 - Service: Having had a spiritual awakening as a result of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, share this message with others and practice these principles in all you do. Watch Erik's story.

item.title: 12 Steps to Change - Series Trailer
item.description: Introducing 12 Steps to Change, an original Mormon Channel video series highlighting the real struggles and triumphs of people who have overcome addiction.

item.title: Something Divine - Brooke White
item.description: Brooke White sings “Something Divine” to remind us that we are all children of God who has given us talents and responsibilities. “Don’t give up until your work is done.”

item.title: The First Noel - Lexi Walker
item.description: Singing phenomenon Lexi Walker makes a Christmas classic, "The First Noel," sound brand new in this music video about the true light of Christmas, the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: Music Video: I'm Trying to Be Like Jesus – Emily Brown
item.description: Emily Brown arranged and performed this version of the Primary song “I’m Trying to Be like Jesus” exclusively for Mormon Channel. Just as she is sharing goodness with all of you, share this video with your friends to spread the light and the love.

item.title: Love Is Spoken Here - Jenny Oaks Baker
item.description: Musician Jenny Oaks Baker and her family share their talents in this arrangement of “Love is Spoken Here.” Love at home is happiness at home.

item.title: Have I Done Any Good in the World Today?
item.description: Music video of "Have I Done Any Good in the World Today?" with Alex Boyé and Carmen Rasmusen Herbert.

item.title: See You On the Other Side - Shaun Canon
item.description: Shaun Canon sings "See You on the Other Side" about seeing our loved ones again after death. The gospel of Jesus Christ provides comfort by knowing that because of God's plan we can see our loved ones who have passed on to "the other side."

item.title: A Pure Love Story
item.description: Though the Lynns’ life is still quite different than most, Jenny and Mark have allowed this tragedy to strengthen their commitment and love for each other.

item.title: Brigham City Temple Art
item.description: Inside the newly completed Brigham City Temple are beautiful murals that depict the surrounding landscape and invite a wonderful spirit. Learn all about the process of creating these beautiful works from the artist, Gary Ernest Smith.

item.title: A Mormon Olympian
item.description: Olympic swimmer Andrew Rutherfurd is competing for Bolivia during the 2012 London games. Andrew is a world-class athlete and a devoted member of the Mormon faith. Learn about his journey to the Olympics and his faith in God.

item.title: A Chapel for Botswana
item.description: Latter-day Saints in Kasane, Botswana, sacrificed for years and traveled great distances to attend church services. Now they have a chapel to call their own.

item.title: Tests and Triumphs
item.description: Sterling and Christian Wyatt were both born with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, a crippling chronic disease. Despite their challenges, the young men each desired to serve a full-time mission.

item.title: Having the Holy Ghost
item.description: You can invite the Holy Spirit into your life through prayer, scripture study and being obedient to God’s commandments.

item.title: Increase Your Testimony
item.description: Strengthen your testimony of God and His teachings by recognizing the feelings of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Feeling the Holy Ghost
item.description: Feelings of the Holy Spirit can be likened to hope, joy and peace in your heart and mind.

item.title: Receiving Revelation
item.description: You can receive personal revelation from God by living His gospel and having the gift of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: The Coat
item.description: The Coat is a children’s story that depicts a young boy giving selflessly to another child in need.

item.title: His Grace: Drug Addiction and the Loss of a Loved One
item.description: By God’s grace we are able to overcome any challenge life brings. And with His Grace we are able to feel the much needed love and comfort amidst our trials.

item.title: His Grace: Unplanned Pregnancy, Adoption and The “Best Gift Ever”
item.description: When Katie became a single mother following an unplanned pregnancy, she couldn’t have imagined the impact her adoption story would have on her faith and others’.

item.title: Finding Your Purpose in Life: Does Faith Matter?
item.description: Rich Miller grew up believing completely in the reality and importance of the gospel. But Rich left his faith behind to search for another kind of truth. He was surprised by what he found.

item.title: Seminary Centennial
item.description: Look back at the 100-year history of the seminary program of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Learn about the men who began the program, and gain insights into how it changes lives. today.

item.title: Sculpting the Prophet
item.description: Blair Buswell has sculpted just about anything you can imagine, but his most cherished work is the bust of Church President Thomas S. Monson. Hear what it was like to work with the prophet, and find out what he told Buswell upon completion.

item.title: A Look Back: The Logan Tabernacle
item.description: Utah historian Kenneth Godfrey shares insight into the historic Logan Tabernacle and gives us a peek at its beautiful pioneer craftsmanship.

item.title: Inspired by The Coat
item.description: See how "The Coat," a Mormon Channel video of an experience from the life of Heber J. Grant, inspired a group of girls to give service.

item.title: Family: One Big Experiment
item.description: The Oh family prefers to work on their chemistry while literally working on chemistry. They create a dry ice solution that will freeze household objects like candy, bottles, and even flowers.

item.title: Pizza with the Puentes
item.description: The Puentes have learned to channel the energy of their home into family chores and activities that are both fun and productive. One of their favorite activities is pizza making in their backyard.

item.title: Raising a Family: Learning the Ropes Together
item.description: Christy, Jay, and their four kids are experts at all sorts of interesting things, but they know their success outside of the home is actually the result of success within the home.

item.title: A Family Culture of Love
item.description: Meet the Pereira family. They love soccer, animals, and making bread because each of those things brings them closer together. Find out how in this episode of Happy Families.

item.title: What Family Means
item.description: The Davies bring new meaning to the phrase “one big, happy family.” With seven kids, Jim and Becky Davies’ family is bigger than they had dreamed it could be.

item.title: A Recipe For a Happy Family
item.description: Too many cooks in the kitchen? That is never a problem for the Chavez family. In fact, making a delicious meal elbow-to-elbow is their favorite way to spend time together.

item.title: Make It a Good Day
item.description: “I think being a mom is the most important job in the world—and I’m not joking,” says mother Clair Kenny, whose big family stars in the first episode of Mormon Channel’s brand new video series, “Happy Families.”

item.title: Blending Families: Love is Key
item.description: Love is the key—that is the motto the Goodjohn family lives by. Whether they are at home or at the park, you can bet that Nandi, Troy, and his daughter Dior are doing their best to show each other how much they care.
